title: Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail: Outgoing server (SMTP) error. The server responded:  Try again later, closing connection..
content:
Not receiving GMAIL account messages.

Cannot send GMAIL account messages

Recently started receiving this error message.

"Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail: Outgoing server (SMTP) error. The server responded: Try again later, closing connection.. " -- This is the full message on screen.

Have tried all the standard "fixes" suggested on Mozilla-related help sites.

Even tried AI solutions. None work.

This happened about a week ago, as well.

Then, a couple of days after, Thunderbird came good and was working as it should.

Come this Monday, it's stopped working again, as per last week!

Is this a GOOGLE issue?

Nothing is working to solve the problem.

Now stuck with no email function on Thunderbird (Desktop PC Win 11)

NOTE: occurs on my Apple IOS, using MS Outlook, as well?!?
creator: bobbyingersoll1960

title: Can Thunderbird handle more than one Exchange mailbox
content:
I have several e-mail accounts on my own domain, via GoDaddy. They suddenly switched their e-mail server to Exchange, which forced me to switch from Thunderbird to Outlook. Can I switch back, yet, or can Tbird only handle one Exchange account?

I am temporarily using Win 10 (with security updates) but will regain access soon to a PC that can run Win 11.
creator: oldmaven

title: Thunberbird 140.5.0esr
content:
Here we go again! After spending a couple of weeks trouble shooting this issue, I thought I had it fixed earlier today.

After using TB for a couple of hours, getting rid of duplicate messages, etc., I shut it down. But when I decided to check emails one more time, the ORIGINAL problem is back, it will NOT delete messages.

I deleted all earlier installs, and did a complete clean install of 140.5.0esr.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1548207
creator: lajoes
